title: SQL ServerLOWER()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerLOWER()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Convert the text to lower-case:
SELECT LOWER('SQL Tutorial is FUN!');

Definition and Usage
The LOWER() function converts a string to lower-case.
Note:
Also look at the
UPPER()
function.
Syntax
LOWER(
text
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
text
Required. The string to convert
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Convert the text in "CustomerName" to lower-case:
SELECT LOWER(CustomerName) AS LowercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT LOWER(CustomerName) AS LowercaseCustomerName
FROM Customers;

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerLOWER()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerLOWER()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerLOWER()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
